meanings.definition: A device used to put out fires.
meanings.sent1: The firefighters quickly grabbed the extinguishers to stop the flames.
meanings.sent2: Make sure the extinguishers are easily accessible in case of an emergency.
meanings.sent3: The extinguishers decided to take a break after a long day of fighting fires.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like an extinguisher, quenching any doubts that arose.
meanings.sent5: The bright red extinguishers stood out against the dark smoke, ready to save the day.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that extinguishes something.
meanings.sent1: He was known as the extinguishers of all arguments in the office.
meanings.sent2: The hero in the story was the ultimate extinguishers of evil.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat saw the extinguishers of its fun when the owner arrived.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor acted as an extinguishers to the escalating tension.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was like an extinguishers of confusion, bringing clarity to the students' minds.

meanings.sent1: The quick extinguishers of the candle flame impressed the audience.
meanings.sent2: His extinguishers of the campfire was swift and efficient.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved the sudden extinguishers of all the lights.

meanings.sent5: The sound of the extinguishers of the bonfire echoed through the quiet night.
